_sText:
I had a lot of free time as of late and had the urge to map again,
so here's my first map in over two years - bhop_contamination.




Traverse through a long-abandoned and dilapidated nuclear facility,
discover hidden easter eggs, and read lore/notes from employees
scattered throughout the map which tell the story of how a tragic
incident caused The Hanley Corporation to go from thriving to forgotten.

Alternate between the present and the past to experience what the facility
used to look like before the incident, and what it has become since.

This map has been crafted with love. I have spent close to 200 hours on
it and managed to make the BSP file size fairly small considering the
reasonably high detail. I have also optimised it as best as I can to
ensure that there are no significant FPS drops when entering new stages.

Gameplay-wise, the map focuses on variation. There are numerous routes
you can take, in addition to dozens of areas where you can save time,
and even some intentional skips to reward players who successfully maintain high
speed during their run.

In addition to this, I have tried my hardest to make this map enjoyable
for both beginners and advanced bhoppers alike. While the optimal route
is obviously intended for the better players, if you fail certain
stages which are designed for high-speed, you will be reset and given a
reasonable amount of velocity. This is done so that casual players who
fail during specific stages can still play through each stage without
having to pre-speed constantly.
